guest.readme.txt:
Hi, guest! If you are new here, try running "[or]help[/]". Using "[or]help + a command[/]" will give you extra info on it.

Also, please note that I don't have any systems for saving progress between terminal sessions, so refreshing the terminal [re]WILL delete all your information[/], write down your keys!

-[lb]lumi[/]

And I'd rather if you didn't play them. Let's just say I like it better this way!

(Mostly grown tired of showing off my stupid 2D tests...)

tools.readme.md:
[lb]You[/]! Beware of spoilers!!

These tools are meant for people that have finished the game, and [re]contain spoilers[/]! You've been warned...

database.dismiss.txt:
I'm done. I quit, I abandon this project.
It feels like a neverending cave, where the only place to go is everywhere but forward.
Sorry. Feel free to finish it yourself if you will. I'm all out of time, I wasn't brave or strong enough.

[??/??/??]
[lg]-?[/]

build.?.txt:
Hey!! I hope you enjoyed the last build, I'm aware it isn't exactly finished, but you can give me your thoughts on this (new) early build.
I was mainly messing up with the hint AI in this one, since I migrated them into a "level" for ever level, as hints.

I've been also trying to implement carvings, and the ending of the game.
(which i accidentallyyy deleted while working)
As always, let me know if you think its a good idea. I'm running out of time to develop this before i leave, lmao.

[27/06/??]
[lg]-?[/]
build.goodbye.txt:
As a sendoff, I know you might be interested in the game, so I've hid something on it's game page. You should be familiar with it already, something to do with your title screen.

[lg]-?[/]

groups.rules.md:
1) Use common sense, or I'll delete your group. 2) Every group must have a "welcome.group" file, with some information. 3) You may password protect groups, and/or hide them. -[or]groups admin[/]

[lg][FILE LOCKED][/]

mazegang.welcome.group: And so you've made it here, fellow mazer.

secrethunters.welcome.group:
Hello everyone! We're a small group of people dedicated to finding secrets between our worlds, and, well- this terminal in specific. We believe that by joining forces, we can do anything. We do, however, have some rules in place to mantain anonymity and security: [gr]1)[/] Do not sign any posts or comments, remain anonymous. [ye]2)[/] Document your findings! [re]3)[/] Do not grief. Due to this being anonymous, we can't really prevent this. Just don't.

[lg][FILE LOCKED][/]

secrethunters.public.txt:
I'm not sure if y'all know this, but looking at the source code, it looks like you can go into public folders.

It's simple.
Any user can create a public folder, and you can go there as a guest.

It also seems like not everyone has one. Weird.
